entry.title: Inked and irked: Apple Watch users report tattoo problems
entry.summary:
That was frustrating and "a bit embarrassing" for Graham Edgell, a Los Angeles printing broker who loves Apple products and was eager to show off his new watch to friends after his wife bought it for him.

As for the Apple Watch issue, some social media users have mocked it as a complaint from spoiled hipsters.

entry.title: Inked and irked: Apple Watch users report tattoo problems
entry.summary: That was a relief for Nick Borelli, a 34-year-old marketing executive in Cleveland who has a black tattoo on the inside of his wrist - not the side where he has worn the Apple Watch.

entry.title: Inked and irked: Apple Watch users report tattoo problems
entry.summary: Even so, "Antennagate" didn't seem to make a dent in the iPhone's popularity or sour Apple's devoted fan base, and it's unlikely that "TattooGate" will make or break the Apple Watch.

entry.title: Inked and irked: Apple Watch users report tattoo problems
entry.summary:
NEW YORK (AP) - It's an annoying problem for the unlucky few: the Apple Watch's heart rate monitor might not work if you have a tattoo on your wrist.

Apple suggests that users who can't get a consistent heart rate reading connect their Apple Watch wirelessly to external heart rate monitors.

An Apple support article says the watch uses green LED lights paired with light-sensitive photodiodes to detect the amount of blood flowing through the wrist and calculate the frequency of heart beats.

"We have been hearing suppliers encountering some bottleneck issues for Apple Watch's production such as problems with its displays, haptics or assembly," he told Reuters, adding that those issues were quite common for new products.

entry.title: Apple Earnings: What to Watch
Software developers try on Apple watch, see more apps coming
entry.summary:
SAN FRANCISCO, April 24 (Reuters) - Software developers who tried on an Apple Watch for the first time on Friday predicted a rush of new apps over the next few months, particularly in areas including health and messaging.

"Health, transportation and social media will be the three main industries that will utilize the Apple Watch."

Tracking firm App Annie counted 3,061 total apps supporting Apple Watch on Friday.

entry.title: Low-key launch as Apple Watch finally goes on sale
entry.summary:
About 50 people lined up to buy the watch at electronic store Bic Camera in Tokyo's Ginza district, while at the nearby Apple Store it was like any other Friday, according to Reuters reporters at the shops.

Wall Street estimates of Apple Watch sales vary widely.

entry.title: Low-key launch as Apple Watch finally goes on sale
Fashion stores to sell apple watch
entry.summary:
Apple Watch buyers will not be able to walk out of an Apple Store with the new wearable when it launches today, but that does not mean you cannot get it elsewhere.

Apple retail chief Angela Ahrendts has previously stated the selling process would be different for the watch than the huge queues normally seen outside the company's store for other products.

entry.title: Apple Watch goes on sale worldwide amid supply shortage
Some Apple Watches to come sooner than expected
entry.summary:
On Wednesday, Apple notified some buyers that they would not have to wait so long after all.

Will the Apple Watch end up on your wrist?

In a note to clients on Wednesday, FDR analyst Daniel Ives estimated Apple would take over 2 million pre-orders for the watch and ship 20 million of them in 2015.

entry.title: Will the Apple Watch Eclipse the Classics?
entry.summary: Apple's first generation watch is only the beginning.

entry.title: Don't plan to line up for Apple Watch next week
entry.summary:
SAN FRANCISCO (AP) - If you're planning on buying the new Apple Watch, don't expect to walk into a store and leave with one next week.

Apple, which began accepting advance orders for the watch last week, had previously said it would be "available" for sale in stores on April 24, at least for customers who made reservations to come in for a personal demonstration.

But with supplies limited, Apple's retail chief has told store workers that the watch will continue to be sold only through online orders for at least the next several weeks.

entry.title: Don't plan to line up for Apple Watch next week
6% of U.S. adults plan to buy Apple Watch: Poll
6% of US adults plan to buy Apple Watch: Poll
entry.summary: The Apple Watch, priced from $349 for a basic Sport model to a $17,000 gold timepiece, lets users check email, listen to music and make phone calls when paired with an iPhone.

entry.title: Exclusive: Six percent of U.S. adults plan to buy Apple Watch - Reuters/Ipsos poll
entry.summary: Among those polled who do not own an iPhone, 8 percent said they would consider switching to an iPhone in order to purchase an Apple Watch.

entry.title: Exclusive: Six percent of U.S. adults plan to buy Apple Watch - Reuters/Ipsos poll
entry.summary:
The poll showed the watch, marketed by Apple as a high-fashion item as well as a new frontier in technology, appealed to fewer than 4 percent of women compared with 9 percent of men.

As far as overall interest in the watch as opposed to intending to buy it, the poll showed that 18 percent of respondents were "very" or "somewhat" interested versus 76 percent who showed no interest.

According to the poll, adults aged between 30 and 39 were the most likely buyers, with 13 percent saying they planed to buy an Apple Watch, followed by 10 percent of 18-to-29-year-olds.

entry.title: Apple likely to boost watch production quickly: analysts
entry.summary: (Reuters) - Apple Inc (AAPL.O) is likely to quickly ramp production of the Apple Watch after strong pre-orders outstripped limited supply in the first weekend following its launch, some Wall Street analysts said.

entry.title: Apple Watch US pre-orders estimated at 1M
entry.summary: Slice Intelligence looked at sample data from 9,080 online shoppers, and said each Apple Watch buyer ordered an average of 1.3 watches and spent an average of $503.83 per device.

entry.title: Apple Watch US pre-orders estimated at 1M
entry.summary: Using e-receipt data, the company said that 957,000 people in the U.S. placed orders for an Apple Watch on the first day it became available.

entry.title: Apple Watch begins its debut around the world
entry.summary:
The watch is Apple's first new product category since the iPad came out five years ago.

Analysts are waiting to see how well the watch will sell beyond devoted Apple fans.

People can try the watch on in Apple stores, but for now all orders are being handled online.

Swiss launch of Apple Watch hit by patent issue
entry.summary:
ZURICH - Apple is not able to launch its new smartwatch in Switzerland until at least the end of this year because of an intellectual property rights issue, Swiss broadcaster RTS reported on its website.

The Apple Watch, the firm's first new device since Tim Cook became CEO, will be available in stores in nine countries on April 24.

entry.title: Tag Heuer to take on Apple with luxury smartwatch
Only 39% of iPhone users interested in Apple Watch: poll
U.S. poll shows 40 per cent of iPhone owners would buy Apple Watch
entry.summary:
U.S. poll shows 40 per cent of iPhone owners would buy Apple Watch Add to...

About 40 percent of adult Apple iPhone owners in the United States are interested in buying the company?s new Apple Watch, according to a new Reuters/Ipsos poll.

Among the iPhone owners, 39 per cent were interested in purchasing the Apple watch, including 17 per cent describing themselves as very interested.

entry.title: Apple Watch may be a tough sell with Americans: 69% not interested in buying the gadget, new poll shows
entry.summary:
Some 46% of respondents said that the Apple Watch had a "cool factor."

But only 29% said they were more interested in purchasing an Apple Watch than another brand of smartwatch.

entry.title: 3 reasons Apple's watch will _ or won't _ change the game
entry.summary: The stakes are big for Apple CEO Tim Cook: the watch is the first brand-new Apple product to be launched without legendary co-founder Steve Jobs.

entry.title: 3 reasons Apple's watch will _ or won't _ change the game
entry.summary:
Will the Apple Watch finally move the needle in the smartwatch industry?

Is the Apple Watch going to be able to do the same?

A recent Forrester survey found some respondents didn't see a reason to buy one because they already owned a less-expensive fitness band or a full-featured smartphone (although it also found Apple fans ready to buy the new watch).

Cook will make his case for the Apple Watch at a press event Monday, where he's expected to show off more features and apps.
